intro: Pourthiaea coreana, commonly known as the Korean pourthiaea, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant features slender stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a slight pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
